text:
Former CIA Director @JohnBrennan told me this morning he believes @POTUS is afraid of Vladimir Putin. I asked why:

BRENNAN: One can speculate as to why, that the Russians may have something on him personally that they could always roll out and make his life more difficult.
author: WillieGeist

text:
Former CIA Director John Brennan with me on @Morning_Joe today:

WG: Do you believe Russia has something on (Trump)?

BRENNAN: ...The Russians have had long experience with Mr. Trump, and may have things they could expose.

WG: Something personal?

BRENNAN: Perhaps. Perhaps.
author: WillieGeist

text:
A group of us went to a Korean BBQ spot called “Wow” last night. 

At the end of a great meal, we couldn’t get a cab to take us back to the hotel, so the restaurant’s owner grabbed the keys to his mini-van, piled 8 of us inside, and drove us home! Korean hospitality. #Wow
author: WillieGeist

text: Some of the Korean BBQ methods (see: cutting the meat with scissors mid-grill) run counter to our lifetimes of accumulated grilling wisdom, but we respect the traditions of our host nation. When in Pyeongchang...

text: We were set up across from the Sandy Hook Volunteer Fire & Rescue where students waited for their parents. The parents who didn't find their children were taken to a back room. Nelba Marquez-Greene, whose daughter Ana was killed, said later: "I knew what the back room meant."
author: WillieGeist

text:
Dawn Hochsprung, Mary Sherlach, Lauren Rousseau, Anne Marie Murphy, Rachel D'Avino, & Vicki Soto did that day at Sandy Hook what my own children's teachers are now trained to do: To stand between their students and a bullet. I am in complete awe of them. 

http://www.msnbc.com/morning-joe/watch/remembering-sandy-hook-five-years-later-1116409411654 …
author: WillieGeist

text: Thinking about the 20 sets of parents who were dropping their first graders at Sandy Hook Elementary right about now, 5 years ago, the 6 families of staff members who gave their lives for someone else's children, and what they all have lived with every day since. RIP. #SandyHook
author: WillieGeist

text:
The Aztec H.S. shooting got lost in the Firehose News Cycle, and kids being murdered at random inside their schools can't become routine.

I am in awe once again that educators and staff, here a substitute teacher and a custodian, consistently risk their lives for their students.
author: WillieGeist

text: Aztec H.S. custodian Thomas Hill was another hero on Thursday. Police say he spotted the shooter and, at risk to his own life, ran through the halls telling teachers to lock their doors. There’s no telling how many lives he saved. When I find his photo, I’ll post it.
author: WillieGeist

author: WillieGeist

text:
And here’s Katie Potter, a substitute teacher at Aztec H.S. She heard the shots & rushed 17 kids into an office, barricading the door with a sofa. 

The shooter fired through the wall for several minutes but hit no one. Katie saved them all & volunteered to work again on Monday.
author: WillieGeist

text:
The two teenagers shot and killed in their New Mexico high school on Thursday, one for walking into the bathroom at the wrong time, one just walking the halls. What a terrible, tragic waste of vibrant lives.

RIP, “Paco” and Casey.
